DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Parent Form Metacognition Index T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Metacognition Index in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Parent Form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Metacognition Index T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher._A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months._An index of the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that reflects the individual's ability to initiate, plan, organize, self-monitor, and sustain working memory. It combines the Initiate, Working Memory, Plan/Organize, Organization of Materials, and Monitor scales._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher.

Property.preferredName: BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Metacognition Index T-Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months.:An index of the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that reflects the individual's ability to initiate, plan, organize, self-monitor, and sustain working memory. It combines the Initiate, Working Memory, Plan/Organize, Organization of Materials, and Monitor scales.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months.

An index of the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that reflects the individual's ability to initiate, plan, organize, self-monitor, and sustain working memory. It combines the Initiate, Working Memory, Plan/Organize, Organization of Materials, and Monitor scales.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: BRIEF-Parent Version:Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Parent Version. Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Steven C. Guy, PhD, and Lauren Kenworthy, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, Lutz, FL, 2000
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 4/2/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean for the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
